info.title: Global Change Information System API
info.description: Who we are, what the GCIS is, and how we use identifiers and semantic information to provide points of reference and traceability. Examples and tutorials for using this system as a researcher, citizen scientist, application developer or information theorist. A description of how the information is structured, including the overlaps between relational and semantic representations of the information. Complete documentation for the API, including methods for browsing and finding resources.

get.summary: List activities.
get.description: List the activities, 20 per page.

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: Set to 1 to get all of the activities.

get.summary: Get a representation of an activity.
get.description: Get JSON which represents the structure of an activity.

parameters.description: Set to 1 to get all of the arrays.

get.summary: Get a representation of an array.
get.description: Get JSON which represents the structure of an array.

parameters.name: with_gcmd
parameters.description: Include GCMD keywords associated with the array.

parameters.name: with_regions
parameters.description: Include regions associated with the array.

get.description: Given a resource (dataset, report, etc.) and a role (editor, etc), and an identifier for an organization, show the resources to which the organization has contributed in that role.

get.summary: List people.
get.description: List the people, 20 per page.

parameters.name: all
parameters.description: Set to 1 to get all of the people.

get.summary: Redirect to a person based on a name
get.description: Given a name (case sensitive, concatenated by dashes), redirect if there is a single match.  The first and last names can be in either order.

get.summary: Redirect to a person based on an ORCID.
get.description: Given an ORCID, if there is a match, redirect to the persons URI.

get.summary: Get a representation of a person.

get.summary: Show contributions of a certain type by a person
get.description: Given a resource (dataset, report, etc.) and a role (editor, etc), and an identifier for a person, show the resources to which the person has contributed in that role.
